Broccoli and its effects on breast cancer

Summary generated using: $shovel3 query.concatConclusions 'breast cancer broccoli site:ncbi.nlm.nih.gov' 40 includeReference=True
  • Sulforaphane inhibits breast CSCs and down-regulates Wnt/β-catenin self-renewal pathway. These findings support the use of sulforaphane for chemoprevention of breast cancer stem cells and warrant further clinical evaluation.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
  • Curcumin and piperine separately, and in combination, inhibit breast stem cell self renewal but do not cause toxicity to differentiated cells. These compounds could be potential cancer preventive agents. Mammosphere formation assays may be a quantifiable biomarker to assess cancer preventive agent efficacy and Wnt signaling assessment a mechanistic biomarker for use in human clinical trials.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
  • We document an unexpected effect of DIM on cell proliferation, which is to stimulate growth by inducing the ERα signaling pathway. Importantly, this proliferative effect of DIM happens with potentially physiological concentrations that can be provided by the diet or by taking caplet supplements.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
